qas.question: When did the Marvel Adventures line cease publishing?

What are two new titles under the Marvel NOW! line of comics?

context: Marvel discontinued its Marvel Adventures imprint in <a0_0><b8_0>March <b5_0>2012<b8_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, and replaced them with a line of <b6_0>two<b6_0/> titles connected to the Marvel Universe TV block. Also in March, Marvel announced its <a3_0>Marvel ReEvolution<a3_0/> initiative that included Infinite Comics, a line of <a1_0>digital comics<a1_0/>, Marvel AR, an application software that provides an <a4_0>augmented reality<a4_0/> experience to readers and Marvel NOW!, a relaunch of most of the company's major titles with different creative teams. Marvel NOW! also saw the debut of new flagship titles including <a2_0><b7_0>Uncanny Avengers and All-New X-Men<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
